normalized: … six months ago.
earth year 2256 a.
d.
, space era year 46, new space era year 2.
at that time, i was in the sand sea.
i was the supreme commander to the flagship rothlingen, a sand sea super battleship developed by die erde for the war on mars.
following that, were the super-death battleships elsa, gloir, sulingen and oldenburg.
beyond that, a new type of battle-cruiser seidlitz, and similar battle-cruisers luiz and frei…
at that time, i was leading the strongest fleet on mars consisting of 5 battleships, 8 battle-cruisers, and 42 other battleships, destroyers and more.
the neo-terras army had gone in to subdue the kushan armed forces, who had been staging a rebellion on mars at the time.
the new-solars army was looking to expand its power and had contributed in the development of a fierce three-way battle, merely making the situation even more chaotic.
in contrast, our die erde martian army was set on going in with passive measures in order to preserve our entire war potential, with the objective to increase our advance furthermore.
at the time, the kushan armed forces had already conquered 80% of mars, but they were bound to get exhausted due to their battle against the combined armies of the neo-terras and the new-solars.
i began the march of our massive fleet, the strongest on mars, which had remained completely intact as well.

name: bohgan
normalized: haven’t you found them yet?
i was biting my nails in frustration on the bridge-deck of the flagship, rothlingen.
it had already been three days since we had started our patrols.
i was eagerly awaiting to the report saying, 『the kushan fleet has been discovered』.

name: bohgan
normalized: well, well.
it looks like the pig-slut has made up her mind to frustrate me.
after the destruction of the terra-forming plant by beatricekushan,
it had not only led to the creation of the sand sea, but had also caused a sudden change in the environment of mars, causing it to become exceedingly turbulent.
that woman had not only created the sand sea, but had also deployed tachyon particles into the atmosphere with the help of environment altering nano-machines.
now, tachyon particles were constantly being released by these environment altering nano-machines into the martian atmosphere.
tachyon particles were semi-permanently suspended in the atmosphere and when absorbed by the plasma-engine of a battleship,
they would react with the plasma in the engine-core and cause a chemical reaction, known as the anti-gravity phenomenon, causing the plasma-engines to malfunction and in the worst cases, explode.
on top of that, tachyon particles had the troublesome property of distorting and absorbing radio waves, and as a result, most of the radar equipment had become dysfunctional.
and, as a result of that,
combat on mars had become limited to ground battles or fleet battles on top of the sand sea, without any air support whatsoever.
moreover, there was no other option but to visually confirm the enemies.
this was almost akin to ancient fleet warfare, in which humans were confined to the ground or the sea.
courtesy of beatrice kushan.

name: bohgan
normalized: good grief.
that woman is completely hopeless.
the kushan fleet had annihilated the fleet of the new-solars and the neo-terras, and was in the process of making a delayed advance towards the die erde dominated region.
we had prepared 30 units consisting of 4 semi-submersible high-speed patrol boats,
and had divided the sandy areas through which the kushan fleet could pass, into 120 rectangular partitions, which would act as zonal patrol areas.

it would allow me to set up an advantageous battlefield against the pig-sluts, who having won the fierce three-way battle would no doubt advance here in their hubris, allowing me to control and eventually triumph over them.
however, it meant we had to wait――

name: muller
normalized: my lord!
they are approaching!

name: bohgan
normalized: here we go!
i stood up, on hearing lieutenant muller’s cry.

name: muller
normalized: our enemy, the kushan fleet, is 120 kilometres off olsen island, in the “e-7” sand sea partition.
muller reported the information with a sneering grin.
when i was invading cordelia, he had merely been my lieutenant and a bit of an unreliable man.
but over time, he had developed good traits.
recently, he had gotten married to a woman who was a hard-core anal-sex addict, and his new bride’s mouth and pussy had also been given an anal remodelling, which had pleased him immensely.
they were a couple well-suited to each other.
anyway, the report which i had been awaiting stirred my staff officers.
needless to say, i was delighted.

name: bohgan
normalized: project the patrol information on the main monitor.

name: muller
normalized: yes!
the patrol information was displayed on the monitor.
this was to be the most crucial information that i would use to formulate and execute my strategy.

name: muller
normalized: as you know, our die erde fleet consists of squadrons 1 through 4.

name: muller
normalized: the kushan fleet, as seen here, consists of squadrons 1 through 3 and it seems to be advancing directly from the north-east direction, with respect to our fleet.
indeed, the kushan fleet was advancing from the north-east to the south-west, towards the die erde controlled sand region.
we were looking at them from the south-west.
as per my calculations, we would definitely emerge victorious due to the sheer scale of our fleet.
obviously, i had to consider an ambush on their part…

name: bohgan
normalized: hmm…
in the war of the sand sea, it was important to know the positions of the enemy beforehand.
no.
that had always been the case in any war.

however, information technology had developed at an abnormal rate over the long course of time, and had transformed the monitoring of patrol information into something which was now considered extremely trivial.
however, on the martian surface, where information technology had been wound a long way back in time, knowing the position of the enemy beforehand had emerged as the most important priority again.

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen!
let me explain my strategy.
i began explaining my strategy for victory to my officers, who were assembled in a row in front of me.

name: bohgan
normalized: muller, bring out the strategy map.

name: muller
normalized: yes, right away.
muller operated the main monitor, and the screen changed.

name: muller
normalized: assuming both sides maintain their advance and speeds,

name: muller
normalized: in 48 hours, the expected scenario will be as seen here.
on the monitor, the distance between the die erde fleet and the kushan fleet reduced.

name: bohgan
normalized: we will use this time to mobilize another detachment.

name: bohgan
normalized: alright.
firstly, we will dispatch the augusta battalion, with its 80 battle-mounts, at its maximum speed and go out to the north of the enemy fleet.
as i said that, the fleet on the monitor started to move.
a detachment split off from the die erde fleet, passed to the north first, and then altered its course to appear on the north-west side of the kushan fleet.
the main forces collided with each other head on, but the separately dispatched battalion was poised, in advance, to strike the enemy from the sides.
it was a high-speed manoeuvre unique to the armoured battleship, the augusta.
the augusta was a mobile weapon, which was said to be a high-speed battleship as well as an armoured-mount, developed especially for combat against the sand sea armoured-mounts.
it had enough firepower and mobility to rapidly pierce the armour of the sand sea armoured-mounts.
it worked well on paper, however, it was a prototype that had been developed hastily at the last moment.
it had a major weakness.
due to the weak armour that was exceedingly inferior to the sand sea armoured-mounts, even infantry armed with grenades could destroy it.
like me, the staff officers who knew of this groaned in unison.
it was a suicidal strategy, equivalent to commanding the augusta to meet its doom as an intercept force.
who the hell would willingly take command of such a detachment?
i could see that question on my men’s faces.

name: bohgan
normalized: i am assigning the command of the augusta to brigadier-general mecklinger.

name: mecklinger
normalized: yes.
a good-looking man, who was in the prime of his life, came forward and saluted me.
he was a man who had racked up distinguished military feats in the war of the tertiary atmosphere of cordelia, under the command of alicia viewstream.
he was a former armoured-mount rider, who boasted having shot down 23 battleships, and had been dubbed cordelia’s wolf.
although, he had the looks which could captivate any young woman who glanced upon him, he was a perverted homosexual, as well as a transvestite.

name: bohgan
normalized: mecklinger, are you confident of victory?

name: mecklinger
normalized: it is impossible, my lord.
even if the augusta has more than twice the numerical advantage, i can’t win against the sand sea armoured-mounts of the enemy.
mecklinger said with a straight face.
he was, undoubtedly, a man trained under the demon princess.
(note: alicia viewstream was also known as the demon princess amongst her adversaries, due to her ferocity in battle.
my staff officers started murmuring.

name: bohgan
normalized: the judgement of our brave veteran, mecklinger, is indeed correct.
however, you will just be acting as a diversion, mecklinger.

name: mecklinger
normalized: yes.
mecklinger bowed.

name: mecklinger
normalized: as you know, the empress is a terribly cunning minx.

name: mecklinger
normalized: if our troops threaten the north, we will definitely be discovered on the enemy patrol network.

name: mecklinger
normalized: alternatively, the empress may realize that it is a diversion, however, it isn’t possible for her to leave her battalion of 80 armoured battleships just waiting there.

name: mecklinger
normalized: the empress has very few choices.

name: mecklinger
normalized: if they do plan to simply wait for us, we will take the assault to their armoured cavalry unit and i will definitely be able to strike them with my battalion.
his judgement was impeccable.
i nodded, before adding to his words.

name: bohgan
normalized: actually, the empress is supposed to think exactly like this.
the opportunity to defeat each one of our battalions, individually, should be too good for her to pass up.

name: bohgan
normalized: i can predict this, because i know that the empress is an excellent commander.

name: bohgan
normalized: furthermore, the enemy’s unknown force, consisting of their armoured cavalry unit, should be exposed when the augusta battalion, with its 80 battle-mounts, strikes them and besides,
i signalled to muller with my eyes, and the fleet positions on the monitor changed again.
the kushan fleet responded to the augusta battalion appearing in the north-west direction, with its armoured cavalry unit.

name: bohgan
normalized: as i mentioned before, it is very difficult for the augusta to win against the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit!

name: bohgan
normalized: however, it is possible to earn time, and that is what our biggest priority is.

name: bohgan
normalized: mecklinger, you know what your role is.

name: mecklinger
normalized: of course, my lord.
mecklinger expressed a cool smile.

name: mecklinger
normalized: confront the enemy fleet with the detached battalion, confirm the presence of the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit, calculate the position of the encounter point with its maximum speed, and set up operations to create an ambush.

name: mecklinger
normalized: that is concerning the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit.
we have a firm grasp on the performance of “the dreadnought” as well, courtesy of the military watchmen’s detailed report.

name: mecklinger
normalized: i think that this ambush along their predicted path is possible with an accuracy of 99.
9%, unfortunately, even if the ambush is successful it does look like we will face difficulties in achieving victory.

name: mecklinger
normalized: even then, it is sufficiently possible, especially if the enemy is damaged and restricted as per our expectations.
mecklinger said this to everyone with extreme fluency.

name: bohgan
normalized: this is an individual shootout strategy, which we will achieve by means of luring the enemy in!

name: bohgan
normalized: we will take our main ship to fight directly against the enemy’s fleet, devoid of their armoured cavalry unit, and destroy it in fleet battle!
the detachment of the augusta battalion engaged in battle with the armoured cavalry unit in the sandy area, north-west of the kushan fleet.
meanwhile, the die erde fleet could be seen advancing towards the kushan fleet.

name: bohgan
normalized: muller, details of the enemy fleet.

name: muller
normalized: yes.
the strength of the kushan fleet is with their mother-ship, the triumph, and the super death battleships seraphis, glasgow, and three other battleships, which are similar to ours.

name: muller
normalized: their battle-cruisers include collingwood, centurion 6, armoured battleship illustrious ii.

name: muller
normalized: there are also 24 other destroyers and battleships.
they are almost half the size of our fleet, and without a doubt, inferior in strength to ours as well.
muller gave the information that he had obtained by investigating the enemy.
i waited for my men to digest all the information and then i declared emphatically.

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen!
the enemy is merely a ragtag group, comprised of three squadrons.

name: bohgan
normalized: this is the true nature of the kushan fleet, who have skulked around behind the shadow of their sand sea armoured cavalry unit like cowards!
if we draw them out into a fleet battle, our victory is assured!

name: bohgan
normalized: although i don’t expect a complete victory, if we strike the enemy’s armoured mother-ship, their armoured cavalry unit will be rendered completely obsolete!

name: bohgan
normalized: without resupplies or maintenance, even the “grim reaper of the sands” will end up being a mere scrap of iron in the sand sea.

name: ingeborg
normalized: my lord, may i ask one thing?
ingeborg called out to me.

name: bohgan
normalized: what is it?

name: ingeborg
normalized: the empress is a sociopath, who has already shown that she has no qualms about destroying the martian environment.

name: ingeborg
normalized: even in the fight against the new-solars and the neo-terras, she often performed manoeuvres which were in stark contrast to the typical warfare models.

name: bohgan
normalized: that is correct.
your point?

name: ingeborg
normalized: is there a need to consider the possibility that the kushan fleet might just ignore the augusta battalion, and send their armoured cavalry unit to our die erde fleet?

name: bohgan
normalized: you are extremely cautious, ingeborg.
however, i have thought of that as well.
at a snap of my finger, the display on the monitor was changed again.
there was a corresponding diagram, in case what ingeborg said transpired.
the augusta battalion assaulted the kushan fleet from the north as they were, and the die erde fleet took a detour and moved away from the advancing armoured cavalry unit.

name: ingeborg
normalized: i see…
ingeborg nodded.
he seemed to have understood the consequences of that.

name: bohgan
normalized: that’s it!
if the enemy catches up to our fleet and sends its armoured cavalry unit towards us, it will end up being even more convenient for us!

name: bohgan
normalized: our fleet will shift positions and earn as much distance as possible from the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit.

name: bohgan
normalized: and following that, all we have to do is destroy the armoured mother-ship of the kushan fleet with the augusta battalion and its 80 battle-mounts!

name: bohgan
normalized: the armoured cavalry unit will be trapped in our pincer attack, and with its mother-ship destroyed, it will run out of fuel and end up like sea-weed in the sand sea!
as i spoke, the battle was being simulated on the monitor.
the augusta battalion attacked the kushan fleet and withdrew after defeating the enemy’s armoured mother-ship,
after which, it attacked the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit from behind, having measured the position of its intercept point with our fleet.
it was the ideal pincer attack, from the front and the back.

name: mecklinger
normalized: excuse me, my lord, but if this does happen then we, of the augusta battalion, are just going to be engaging in striking them with free cheap-shots and won’t be able to participate in any fun whatsoever.

name: bohgan
normalized: hahahahaha!
mecklinger, i am sorry, however, i need someone to play the supporting role.

name: mecklinger
normalized: your will is my command.
let us just say that i will be mourning the empress for her stupidity.
mecklinger said so, and the men burst out in laughter.

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen!

name: bohgan
normalized: the all-powerful female commodore of mars has been trapped in my prison already!

name: bohgan
normalized: victory to you, for the glory of die erde!
cheers rose up, as i declared it loudly.

name: bohgan
normalized: to victory!

name: my men
normalized: victory!

name: bohgan
normalized: rape and death to the pig-sluts!

name: my men
normalized: rape and death!
i raised my right arm into the air powerfully, which was pumping full of hot blood.
the excited men responded to me in kind.
about 48 hours later…
in the planned area of the sand sea, the die erde fleet was about to trap the kushan fleet from the front.
the situation had progressed as per my expectations.
